title: Mass. men sentenced to prison for mail theft, check fraud scheme
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Massachusetts men Imanol Rios-Franco and Brandon Baez sentenced to federal prison for mail theft and check fraud.
Rios-Franco sentenced to 35 months; Baez sentenced to 24 months. Both ordered to pay restitution over $10,000.
Scheme involved stealing checks from USPS, altering them, and redepositing into controlled accounts from June 2023 to February 2024.

title: Milford teen detained by ICE last year invited to State of the Union address
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Marcelo Gomes da Silva, a Milford teen detained by ICE last year, was invited to the State of the Union address.
Rep. Seth Moulton invited Gomes, highlighting that his story highlights issues with the U.S. immigration system.
Gomes was detained while driving his father's car; ICE targeted his father over immigration status issues.

title: Jeremy Swayman shares humorous response to regrettable goal in first Olympic start
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Jeremy Swayman allowed a center-ice goal in Team USA's win over Denmark during his first Olympic hockey game.
Swayman attributed his missed goal to visibility issues, joking about his colorblindness amidst widespread speculation on the black boards.
Despite the goal, Team USA comfortably won with strong offense, and Swayman made 18 stops in the preliminary Olympic match.

title: NBA stars and legends weigh in on Jayson Tatum’s potential return this season
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Jayson Tatum may return this season from an Achilles injury, potentially boosting the Celtics' playoff prospects.
Kevin Durant and Carmelo Anthony commented on Tatum's anticipated return, noting his potential impact on the Celtics.
Tatum has been practicing with the Celtics' G League affiliate, signaling progress in his recovery for a possible comeback.

title: 5 free agents that might make the most sense for Patriots to pursue at positions of need
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots have $41 million in cap space for offseason acquisitions.
Colts WR Alec Pierce and Packers OT Rasheed Walker are potential targets.
Ravens TE Isaiah Likely and Eagles EDGE Jaelan Phillips also considered for potential signings.

title: Making some sense of the new ESPN/MLB.TV streaming partnership and what it means to fans
author: Chad Finn
bullets: ESPN and MLB.TV announced a partnership making ESPN the new streaming home for MLB.TV.
MLB.TV is available as a $134.99 add-on for ESPN Unlimited subscribers, while non-subscribers can get it for $149.99.
Certain providers already offer ESPN Unlimited, which costs $29.99 monthly and is not required for MLB.TV after a free trial.

title: ‘We’re real excited’: Celtics’ Ron Harper Jr. shares Jayson Tatum looked like himself in recent G League practice
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jayson Tatum practiced with the Maine Celtics, sparking speculation of his return after an Achilles tear in May.
Ron Harper Jr. expressed excitement about Tatum's potential comeback, highlighting his performance in G League practice.
Celtics president Brad Stevens stated Tatum won't play until fully recovered; no timetable for his return yet.

title: Here’s where Mass. finished on the latest list of most educated states
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Massachusetts ranked as the most educated state in the US in WalletHub's 2026 study.
Over 47% of Massachusetts adults have bachelor's degrees, and nearly 22% hold advanced degrees.
Vermont and Maryland ranked second and third, while Louisiana, Mississippi, and West Virginia ranked lowest.

title: One of the rarest baseball cards is up for auction â€” and there are local connections
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: A T206 Honus Wagner baseball card from 1909 is up for auction until February 21.
The card has local ties, originating from Morton Bernstein's family business in Taunton, Massachusetts.
Current bid for the card is $3.9 million, potentially totaling $4.758 million with fees.

title: Bruins G Jeremy Swayman set to make Olympic debut and start for Team USA vs. Denmark
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jeremy Swayman will start in goal for Team USA against Denmark in the 2026 Winter Olympics on Saturday.
Swayman helped Team USA win the 2025 IIHF World Championship and is having a solid 2025-26 NHL season.
Bruins defenseman Charlie McAvoy will join Swayman on the ice against Denmark; Team USA plays Germany next on Sunday.
